text: an unfortunate title for a film that has nothing endearing about it
viewers will need all the luck they can muster just figuring out who s who in this pretentious mess
it is messy  uncouth  incomprehensible  vicious and absurd
like a soft drink that s been sitting open too long  it s too much syrup and not enough fizz
the lead actors share no chemistry or engaging charisma
the comedy is nonexistent
diane lane s sophisticated performance ca nt rescue adrian lyne s unfaithful from its sleazy moralizing
the laughs are as rare as snake foo yung
has all the hallmarks of a movie designed strictly for children s home video  a market so insatiable it absorbs all manner of lame entertainment  as long as 3yearolds find it diverting
those who are not acquainted with the author s work  on the other hand  may fall fast asleep
with its parade of almost perpetually wasted characters  margarita feels like a hazy high that takes too long to shake
the results are far more alienating than involving
you d think by now america would have had enough of plucky british eccentrics with hearts of gold
it may sound like a mere diseaseof  theweek tv movie  but a song for martin is made infinitely more wrenching by the performances of reallife spouses seldahl and wollter
a picture as erratic as its central character
elmo touts his drug as being 51 times stronger than coke
anyone who gets chills from movies with giant plot holes will find plenty to shake and shiver about in  the ring
trailer park magnolia  too long  too cutesy  too sure of its own importance  and possessed of that peculiar tension of being too dense  about nothing at all
birthday girl  is an actor s movie first and foremost
and  there s no way you wo nt be talking about the film once you exit the theater
koury frighteningly and honestly exposes one teenager s uncomfortable class resentment and  in turn  his selfinflicted retaliation
an uncluttered  resonant gem that relays its universal points without lectures or confrontations
maybe it is formula filmmaking  but there s nothing wrong with that if the film is wellcrafted and this one is
caine makes us watch as his character awakens to the notion that to be human is eventually to have to choose
there is simply no doubt that this film asks the right questions at the right time in the history of our country

it cuts to the core of what it actually means to face your fears  to be a girl in a world of boys  to be a boy truly in love with a girl  and to ride the big metaphorical wave that is life  wherever it takes you
sex with strangers is fascinating
williams creates a stunning  taxi driveresque portrayal of a man teetering on the edge of sanity
the increasingly diverse french director has created a film that one can honestly describe as looking  sounding and simply feeling like no other film in recent history
delightfully rendered
